title: Courant algebroid without constraints on fluxes on its Dirac structures
abstract:
We consider the standard Courant algebroid and show how the $O(D,D)$ group
elements give rise to the family of Courant algebroids, defined with different
twisted Courant brackets. With the appropriate transformation of the anchor, we
show that all Courant algebroid relations are a priori satisfied. We analyze a
couple of Courant algebroids relevant for string theory and their respective
Dirac structures, obtaining constraints they impose on fluxes. In the end, we
show that the Courant algebroid that is simultaneously twisted by both $B$ and
$\theta$ is characterized by Dirac structures with no restrictions imposed on
fluxes.
